title: Godefs produces a misaligned struct for SDL_keysym - problem with enum fields?
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. On a system where the SDL (http://www.libsdl.org/) headers are
installed, write the following C file keysym.c:
----
#include <SDL/SDL.h>

typedef SDL_keysym $keysym;
----
2. Run godefs -g sdl keysym.c

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

A struct layout which I manually came up with and which works is:
----
type keysym struct {
	Scancode uint8
	Sym uint32
	Mod uint32
	Unicode uint16
}
----

What I get using godefs is:
----
type keysym struct {
	Scancode uint8;
	Pad0 [3]byte;
	Sym byte;
	Mod byte;
	Unicode uint16;
	Pad1 [2]byte;
}
----

Using the struct generated by godefs, the field "Unicode" doesn't get the
value it has on the C side.

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?

linux 386

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)

e45c92bd719c tip

Please provide any additional information below.

The struct SDL_keysym is defined in /usr/include/SDL/SDL_keyboard.h:
----
typedef struct SDL_keysym {
	Uint8 scancode;			/* hardware specific scancode */
	SDLKey sym;			/* SDL virtual keysym */
	SDLMod mod;			/* current key modifiers */
	Uint16 unicode;			/* translated character */
} SDL_keysym;
----

SDLKey and SDLMod are enums defined in /usr/include/SDL/SDL_keysym.h.
